Censored¶

class censored.Tobit(add_intercept: bool = False, compute_statistics: bool = True)¶

A regression model for censored or truncated variables

bootstrap(X: numpy.ndarray)¶

Implement bootstrap method for marginal effect variance computation for Logit and Probit Bootstrap variance of marginal effects (X (n x k)) Output: (n x k) - variances for k marginal effects for the n observations

compute_marginal_effects(X: numpy.ndarray, theta: numpy.ndarray, out: str = 'latent')¶

Calculate marginal effects given X and theta out:

‘latent’ : dE[y*|X]/dx ‘censored’ : dE[y|X]/dx

compute_statistics()¶

Compute standard error

delta_method()¶

Implement delta method for marginal effect variance computation for Logit or Probit

fit(X: numpy.ndarray, y: numpy.ndarray)¶

Fit censored model, using the BFGS algorithm for MLE (minimize the negative log-likelihood)

get_covariance_matrix(cov_type: str = 'sandwich')¶

Compute covariance matrix for the parameters The asymptotical variance is the inverse information matrix

get_dummy_columns()¶

refresh dummy_columns list - tells which column in X is dummy variable, which one is continuous

get_marginal_effect_variances(X: numpy.ndarray)¶

Calculate variance of marginal effects X (n x k) Output: (n x k) - variances for k marginal effects for the n observations

get_marginal_effects(X: numpy.ndarray, variances: bool = True)¶

Calculate marginal effects X (n x k) - must follow the structure of X Output: (n x k) - k marginal effects for the n observations

variances: - variances for the (n x k) marginal effects -> return (marginals, var_marginals)

hessian(theta: numpy.ndarray)¶

Compute and construct hessian at theta, the formulae found in Calzolari & Fiorentini 1993

information()¶

Implement Fisher Information matrix computation

objective_function(theta: numpy.ndarray)¶

negative log likelihood theta: {beta, sigma}

outer_product(theta: numpy.ndarray)¶

Compute outer product of gradients at theta the formulae found in Calzolari & Fiorentini 1993

predict(X, out: str = 'latent')¶
Predict out:

‘latent’ : E[y* | X] ‘censored’ : E[y | X] ‘truncated’ : E[y | y>0,X] ‘P(censored)’ : P(y=0 | X) ‘P(uncensored)’ : P(y>0 | X)

score(theta: numpy.ndarray)¶

Implement objective function derivative

Quantitative Method Collection
